basics.name: Samuel Rasay Jr.
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2018. I plan to pursue a career in security, IT management, or education.

highlights: Troubleshoot software, hardware and networking issues over the phone
Answer phone and email responses to the ITS Help Desk
Assist students, faculty, and staff in-person with requests
Troubleshoot software, hardware and networking issues over the phone
Answer phone and email responses to the ITS Help Desk
Assist students, faculty, and staff in-person with requests
Create course material to teach students basics of underwater robotics
Teach kids technical skills such as public speaking and technical writing

Responsible for making reservations and for the efficient and accurate handling of all associated paperwork for charter services to Las Vegas, as well as providing excellent service to customers both in-person or over the phone.

awards.title: Fourth Place
awards.summary: My team and I were awarded fourth place on the international stage of the MATE ROV competition.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team and I were awarded first place in both 2012 and 2013.

awards.title: NOAA Pacific Region Award
awards.summary: My partner and I were given this award for our research regarding buoyancy systems in underwater robotics.
